TextView.android:text: Accelero-Botix is a new approach to the Human Machine Interface. It is based on the implementation of acceleration sensor on robotics, graphics and embedded application development. This technology is now widely used in virtual reality, mobile phones, gaming solutions, animated movies etc.\nTathva '11 is going to take you through the world of accelero-botix with the best of its kind workshop, conducted by Technophilia.

1. Fundamentals of AVR series of microcontroller
2. Programming the microcontroller using embedded C
3. Interfacing and controlling various devices like keypad, LED, buzzer, motors, sensors etc with microcontroller
4. Implementation of I2C communication protocol
5. Making serial communication with PC using hyper terminal and UART communication protocol
6. Speed control of DC motor using PWM
7. Interfacing acceleration sensor with microcontroller
8. Interfacing acceleration sensor with PC
9. Recognizing hand gesture using acceleration sensor
10. Computer graphics control using acceleration sensor
11. Controlling Robotic vehicle using acceleration sensor

INTRODUCTION

1. Introduction to robotics
2. Introduction to embedded systems
3. Introduction to Human machine interface (HMI)
4. Introduction to Human Computer interface (HCI)

Microcontroller

1. Overview of popular microcontrollers
2. The AVR series of microcontrollers and its core
3. AVR microcontroller features and capabilities

Programming

1. Embedded C
2. Use of Embedded C IDE
3. Use of flash tool
4. Writing code in embedded C
5. Accessing various functions of AVR microcontroller using embedded C
6. Basic I/O operations
7. Timers and counters
8. UART communication protocol
9. I2C communication protocol
10. PWM wave generation
11. Implementation of artificial intelligence using embedded C

Actuators

1. Basics on servo and stepper motor
2. Interfacing geared DC motor
3. Controlling the speed of DC motor using PWM
4. Use of DC motor for Robotic vehicle maneuvering

Sensors

1. Basics on different types of sensors used in robotics
2. Basics on Optical, ultrasonic, infrared, acceleration and gyro sensor
3. Different interfacing technologies used to interface sensors

Acceleration Sensor: Concepts and Activities

1. What is an acceleration sensor?
2. Working principle of an acceleration sensor
3. Types of acceleration sensors available in market
4. Different interfacing technologies used with acceleration sensor
5. Hardwire interfacing circuitry of a 3 axis acceleration sensor
6. Register configuration of an acceleration sensor
7. Reading x, y, z and tilt parameters
8. Configuring the acceleration sensor for shake detection
9. Configuring the acceleration sensor for tap detection
10. Configuring the Acceleration sensor for orientation detection
11. Mapping the hand gesture through acceleration sensor and controlling a robotic vehicle
12. Interfacing acceleration sensor with PC for computer graphics manipulation

1. Microcontroller development board(1)
2. Acceleration sensor(1)

4. USB cable(1)
5. A set of robotic chassis(1)
6. Geared DC motor(2)
